@SteveMartinToGo Not romantic? Steve. How could you forget our weekend at the @delcoronado. You, me, that surrey with the fringe on top? It's burned forever into my heart.

@SnowSnowSnow @amywebb @mcbill @ant_pruitt @karstenbondy Apple showed Photoshop and MS Office running natively on the A12Z in June. It's not the big apps and companies you need to worry about. It's the little boutique apps, oddball hardware, and other edge cases.

@SnowSnowSnow @amywebb @mcbill @ant_pruitt @karstenbondy Friends don't let friends use Creative Cloud. But seriously, Apple has already shown Photoshop running on Apple Silicon. I expect CC to run fine.

@amywebb @mcbill @ant_pruitt @karstenbondy You may not make predictions, but I do. Apple Silicon will blow everything else out of the water. Apple has been doing custom chips since 2007 and they're no more ARM than an A14 is a Snapdragon. Purpose built beats general purpose like a tailored suit beats ready-to-wear.

@amywebb @mcbill @ant_pruitt @karstenbondy You won't be waiting more than 6 months for a good Apple Silicon iMac. And while "Pro" level Macs will probably take longer, I don't think you a Pro. If you're buying "Pro" to future-proof then buying an Intel Pro is exactly the wrong thing to do.

@amywebb @mcbill @ant_pruitt @karstenbondy I'm with @JoannaStern. As the owner of one of the last few PowerPC Macs I can tell you the Intel Macs will start looking outdated pretty quickly. Get an iMac Pro if you have to (not a Mac Pro) but wait if you can. Apple Silicon is going to be amazing.

That's really cool! Thanks! But do us a favor - instead of creating feeds linking to Steve's 16kbps audio can you link to the higher quality audio so we can count the downloads?

@realjohngalt3 @MikeElgan @nightcam @amywebb @TWiT @mmasnick @iainthomson @LisaLaPorte @meganmorrone @Scobleizer @ant_pruitt @OMGchad @THErealDVORAK I walk a fine line in these round table shows between encouraging vigorous debate and interrupting. And in this case I over corrected. Amy is always worth hearing in full. She'll be back, and I'll sit back and listen next time.

@MikeElgan @realjohngalt3 @nightcam @amywebb @TWiT @mmasnick @iainthomson @LisaLaPorte @meganmorrone @Scobleizer @ant_pruitt @OMGchad @THErealDVORAK The good news Mike is that I'm pretty much inured to the excoriations of the twitter mob!

@realjohngalt3 @amywebb @iainthomson @zott_jim @mmasnick I listen to all feedback, but a couple of tweets doesn't really constitute a consensus. The challenge on a roundtable show is to keep the conversational momentum going. I prefer our shows to sound more like an Italian family at Sunday dinner than a Quaker meeting.
@realjohngalt3 @MikeElgan @nightcam @amywebb @TWiT @mmasnick @iainthomson @LisaLaPorte @meganmorrone @Scobleizer @ant_pruitt @OMGchad @THErealDVORAK Yes. You are wrong.

@NuAngel @thebestbumalive @SGgrc We'll talk about it next week. 

I apologize for not saying anything at the time.
@NuAngel @thebestbumalive @SGgrc I know Steve was just making a joke - he doesn't have a mean bone in his body. But we all need to work a little harder to root out systemic racism in tech.

@NuAngel @thebestbumalive @SGgrc I'm with you. I should have said something. As I've told Steve before, I totally support the movement to replace those inappropriate terms. Besides being offensive they're not particularly descriptive. "Allow list" "Block list" "Host" and "Client" are better all around.
Me, too!!

@BrandonGiesing @thecraigstone @Victor_Lucas @patricknorton Even though they fired me (and @patricknorton) and turned our show into a farce, and prohibit me from playing that final segment from AOTS for copyright reasons, I truly hold no grudges. G4 is gone and TWiT has not only survived but thrived. I probably should thank them!

@ant_pruitt This is one of the topics we'll cover in next week's Lastpass event. Identity is hard and we need a trusted third-party to help with these issues. But should it be government? Private industry? There are issues.

@ant_pruitt No this is good for Zoom, I guess. But @KeybaseIO provided a very important tool for identity verification that is now gone. 

Honestly I hate Zoom but since we're forced to use it by people who don't know better, it's good they're "trying" to do better.

@Whatsupdoc114 We host our own @jitsinews server - but I can never get anyone to use it. I have crap installed on my Mac from a half-dozen other conferencing systems. Jitsi is fast, clean, and easy to setup and use. With zero brand recognition apparently.
@npch @threader_app compile
@ramriot @KeybaseIO Never gave @keybaseio anything but public keys - so no risk there. My public key remains unchanged. My private key is still closely held and secure.
If anyone made the mistake of storing their _private_ pgp/gpg key on @KeybaseIO  now would be an excellent time to delete it. And, perhaps, to re-consider your life choices.

Sigh. @KeybaseIO if you needed money you should have asked us, your devoted users. Why'd you have to do us this way. 

Account deleted. Period.

Closing my account at keybase now. Looking for a replacement. Zoom is NOT a trusted repository. I am very disheartened. 

Any suggestions for a self-hosted replacement for keybase folks?
